titleStmt.title: Alphabetic iambics and hexameters (incl. palindrome verse transmitted as Anth. Pal. 016 387c)

availability.p: © Digital Corpus of Literary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License .

msIdentifier.idno: Florence, Istituto Papirologico 'G. Vitelli' PSI inv. 2412

encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Julia Lougovaya-Ast 2018-07-20: "Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Looks good." Marco Perale 2018-07-20 12:27:20: "Changes incorporated: see below. Text: note the likely omission in l. 6; YES, NOTED IN THE COMMENTARY in l. 8, is ψήφῳ a correction form ψήφι? In any case, why to postulate an iota adscr. as opposed to subscr.? YES, NOTED THE SCRIBAL CORRECTION IN LEIDEN+ In l. 13, there can hardly be more than one missing letter where [ ] is printed, or perhaps there is none at all? Can this be verified? IT’S EITHER NO SPACE OR ‘ι’; I THINK [.?] IS PREFERABLE OVER [.1?], AS IT IS TECHNICALLY CASE OF ‘Lost character gap unknown quantity’. In metadata: I'd suggest to record APl in parenthesis since a) it pertains to only one line of the text; b) the inclusion of that verse in APl is rather an evidence/attestation than a title. MAKES SENSE. CHANGED INTO: “alphabetic iambics and hexameters (incl. palindrome verse transmitted as Anth. Pal. 016 387c)” Julia Lougovaya-Ast 2018-07-20: "Return-Straight-to-Sender - Text: note the likely omission in l. 6; in l. 8, is ψήφῳ a correction form ψήφι? In any case, why to postulate an iota adscr. as opposed to subscr.? In l. 13, there can hardly be more than one missing letter where [ ] is printed, or perhaps there is none at all? Can this be verified? In metadata: I'd suggest to record APl in parenthesis since a) it pertains to only one line of the text; b) the inclusion of that verse in APl is rather an evidence/attestation than a title."

Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Julia Lougovaya-Ast 2018-07-20: "Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Looks good." Marco Perale 2018-07-20 12:27:20: "Changes incorporated: see below. Text: note the likely omission in l. 6; YES, NOTED IN THE COMMENTARY in l. 8, is ψήφῳ a correction form ψήφι? In any case, why to postulate an iota adscr. as opposed to subscr.? YES, NOTED THE SCRIBAL CORRECTION IN LEIDEN+ In l. 13, there can hardly be more than one missing letter where [ ] is printed, or perhaps there is none at all? Can this be verified? IT’S EITHER NO SPACE OR ‘ι’; I THINK [.?] IS PREFERABLE OVER [.1?], AS IT IS TECHNICALLY CASE OF ‘Lost character gap unknown quantity’. In metadata: I'd suggest to record APl in parenthesis since a) it pertains to only one line of the text; b) the inclusion of that verse in APl is rather an evidence/attestation than a title. MAKES SENSE. CHANGED INTO: “alphabetic iambics and hexameters (incl. palindrome verse transmitted as Anth. Pal. 016 387c)” Julia Lougovaya-Ast 2018-07-20: "Return-Straight-to-Sender - Text: note the likely omission in l. 6; in l. 8, is ψήφῳ a correction form ψήφι? In any case, why to postulate an iota adscr. as opposed to subscr.? In l. 13, there can hardly be more than one missing letter where [ ] is printed, or perhaps there is none at all? Can this be verified? In metadata: I'd suggest to record APl in parenthesis since a) it pertains to only one line of the text; b) the inclusion of that verse in APl is rather an evidence/attestation than a title."

Submit - Originally submitted to litpap.info 2018.07.19 by Marco Perale. Submission has been transferred to papyri.info. Submission notes were: "I am in the process of entering all metrical pangrams. Deleted volume number in Editions & Bibliography/Preview; moved content from Legacy Display to Display; added info on script (both in Physical Description and General Notes); added MP3 number; added measurements; added bibliography"

div.ab:
λάβδα ἐπὶ λάβδα
λoγιαλόγια θεὰλογία μία F. Maltomini, PSI XVλογιωτάτα ed. pr. δέσποινα, χαῖρ’ ἄνασσα Βαλ
χεῖ ἐπὶἐπεὶ χεῖ
χάλαζα πικρὰπεικρὰ μηνὶ γίνεταιγείνεται Χοίαχ
ψεῖ ἐπὶἐπεὶ ψεῖ
ψαλμὸν βέλους ἵν’ εὐσστοχωῖ σ’ Ἄραψ
ψυχρὸν διεσπάρασσε πτῶμα ὄνυξι γύψ
ψήφῳψηφι πεταμένην γέρανον ἔβαλεν Αἰθίοψ
ψαρὸν κατεκτένιξεν ἵππον Αἰθίοψ
ψελιοῦχον ἅρμα ἔζευξε Ταντάλου Πέλοψ
στίχοι ἐξ ἀμφοτέρων
τῶν μερῶν ἀναγιγνωσκόμενοι
νορτεπισυνινακαπροννορπακανινυσιπετρον
ἤδη μοι Διὸς ἄρ’ ἀπάτα παρὰ σοί, Διομήδη
στίχοι τῶν στοιχίων πάντων
ὑψιβρεμέτης φερεπιφέρε πῖλονedφερεπι

item.p: Line is most probably corrupt. Metre requires two more syllables between βέλους and and ἵν'. Di Benedetto proposed to emend εὐστοχω to ἐυστοχοῖ. Lloyd-Jones and Parsons suggested ψαλμῷ (or ψαλμοῖ) βέλους βάλλουσιν εὐστόχῳ (or εὐστόχως) σ’, Ἄραψ.

div.p: Informal but fluent hand with ornamental apices.
